decision_conditions: The applicant has not adequately demonstrated that condition 3 (Materials) of listed building consent 22/01248/LBC can be discharged. Before condition 3 (Materials) of listed building consent 22/01248/LBC can be discharged, Kingston Council need samples for all facing materials to be submitted to the Council. Confirmation is needed that the size, weight and composition of the proposed tiles matches those existing. It is not clear how the proposed tiles would relate to those existing. The tiled roof is described as patterned in the listing description. However, insufficient details have been provided for the different types of tiles existing and proposed, to ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Insufficient cogent details have been provided confirming the proposed roof build up. Detailed information (i.e. annotated elevation drawing -as existing, and as proposed) illustrating the different types and sizes of tiles, needs to be provided, along with close up photographs of the existing roof, to ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
